thread.title: A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup
thread.title_full: A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup

author: DOUG FERGUSON
title: A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup
text:
Ahn Young-joon A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup 
US team captain Jay Haas, left and his son Bill address a press conference after they defeated the International team 15 1/2 to 14 1/2 to retain the Presidents Cup at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Lee Jin-man A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup 
US team captain Jay Haas, left and his son Bill address a press conference after they defeated the International team 15 1/2 to 14 1/2 to retain the Presidents Cup at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Woohae Cho An exciting outcome in Presidents Cup, nothing more 
US team captain Jay Haas, front centre, poses with his team after they defeated the International team 15 1/2 to 14 1/2 to retain the Presidents Cup at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Woohae Cho) Ahn Young-joon A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup 
US team captain Jay Haas, left, embraces his son Bill after he won his singles match to defeat the International team to help retain the Presidents Cup golf at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Ahn Young-joon A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup 
US team captain Jay Haas, second left, and his wife Jan embrace their son Bill, right, after he won his singles match against International team player Sangmoon Bae of South Korea at the Presidents Cup golf at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Posted: Sunday, October 11, 2015 11:51 pm | Updated: 4:00 am, Mon Oct 12, 2015. A special moment for Jay and Bill Haas at Presidents Cup Associated Press | 
INCHEON, South Korea (AP) — Jay Haas took a deep breath, trying to calm nerves he had only ever felt on the golf course while playing. His U.S. team was one point away from winning the Presidents Cup, and the final match added another layer of emotion. 
American victory depended on Bill Haas, who was much more than a captain's pick. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.   Need an account?
